title: Travel briefs: Local travel events
text:

Travel briefs: Local travel events Travel By Steve Stephens Dispatch • Sunday July 19, 2015 5:00 AM Greek festival on tap 
One of Ohio’s largest Greek festivals will take place at the St. Demetrios Greek Orthodox Church Community Center in Warren from Wednesday through Sunday. 
The free festival will include traditional Greek food as well as music, rides and games. 
Call 330-394-9021 or visit www.stdemetrioswarren.org Oakley to be saluted 
Downtown Greenville will celebrate hometown hero and legendary sharpshooter Annie Oakley from Thursday through Sunday. 
Local merchants will hold sidewalk sales, and visitors can take a motor coach tour of historic Darke County with a stop at the Garst Museum and the National Annie Oakley Center. The museum will also host a gathering of artists, craftsmen, living history re-enactors and more on Saturday and Sunday. 
Call 937-316-4777 or visit www.mainstreetgreenville.org or www.gatheringatgarst.com Bucyrus to look back 
The Bucyrus Historical Museum will host its annual Museum Day from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday. 
Guests can watch broom-making and wood- and ice-carving demonstrations, experience a monkey organ-grinder and enjoy ice cream at the free event. 
Call 1-866-562-0720 or visit www.bucyrus.org Nature to be focus 
America’s first presidential library, the Hayes Presidential Center at Spiegel Grove in Fremont, will celebrate GroveFest from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Saturday. 
More than a dozen nonprofit environmental organizations will provide hands-on activities for all ages. Guests can also take horse-drawn carriage rides of the grounds. 
Call 419-332-2081 or visit www.rbhayes.org
